oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Davidson County Courthouse, Nashville, Tennessee, circa 1970s
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An aerial photograph of the Davidson County Courthouse and Public Building, Nashville, Tennessee, circa 1970s. The Davidson County Courthouse, also known as Metropolitan Courthouse, is an Art Deco building built in 1936. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1987. It was designed by Nashville architect Emmons H. Woolwine and the firm of Dennison and Hirons of New York. Forms part of the Metro Archives Photographs, Buildings Collection. 1 color photograph.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Davidson County Court House (Nashville, Tenn.)--History--Sources
